detail_description: Piazza Delle Erbe is a charming square in Verona, Italy. It features ornate Gothic funerary monuments, including the elaborate tombs of the Della Scala family. The square is known for its historical significance and beautiful architecture, making it a must-visit destination for travelers exploring Verona.
name: Piazza Delle Erbe

excerpt: Landmark Romanesque church with vast bronze doors & an airy frescoed interior rich in religious art.
detail_description: Basilica di San Zeno Maggiore is a stunning example of Romanesque architecture located in Verona, Italy. This landmark church, dedicated to Saint Zeno, boasts a rich history and houses an array of religious art. The interior is adorned with airy frescoes and an extraordinary 12th-century bronze door depicting biblical scenes and the saint's miracles. Visitors can also admire Mantegna's vibrant altarpiece, adding to the spiritual and artistic allure of this architectural masterpiece.
name: Basilica di San Zeno Maggiore
address: Piazza San Zeno, 2, 37123 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Well-preserved, Roman amphitheater, built to seat 20,000 people, hosting summer opera program.
detail_description: The Arena di Verona is a well-preserved Roman amphitheater located near Piazza Bra in the city center. Built in the 1st century AD, it was designed to accommodate up to 20,000 spectators and has retained its original appearance. While not as famous as the Colosseum, it is a stunning piece of architecture with a rich history. In ancient times, it hosted traditional games and shows and later became a venue for events and parties under Scaliger domination.
name: Arena di Verona

detail_description: Stroll through the archway at the end of Piazza dei Signori to discover the intricate Gothic funerary monuments, which are the ornate tombs of the Della Scala family.
name: Piazza dei Signori

excerpt: Verona's tallest Medieval tower, built by the Lamberti family in 1172 & offering panoramic views.
detail_description: In the heart of Verona's Old City, stands the impressive Torre dei Lamberti, a medieval tower built in 1172 by the influential Lamberti family. Rising to a height of 84 meters, it offers commanding views of the ancient city and its red-tiled rooftops. Visitors can climb this historic landmark for panoramic vistas over Verona.
name: Torre dei Lamberti
address: Via della Costa, 1, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: First finished in 100 BCE, this scenic Roman arch bridge was rebuilt after being destroyed in WWII.
detail_description: Ponte Pietra is a picturesque Roman arch bridge in Verona, first constructed in 100 BCE and later rebuilt following its destruction in World War II. It's considered one of the city's most romantic symbols. The area around Ponte Pietra offers various attractions such as historical sites like Teatro Romano, Castelvecchio, and ancient churches. Additionally, there are elegant cafes, artisan shops, and high-end boutiques that contribute to the city's charming atmosphere.
name: Ponte Pietra

detail_description: Castelvecchio is a must-see attraction in Verona, offering free entry to its medieval castle and museum. The well-preserved castle has been restored and renovated, housing an educational museum with an armory, statues, and artifacts. Visitors can enjoy a fantastic view from the bridge over the Etsch River and explore paintings from various eras inside the castle museum.
name: Castelvecchio

excerpt: Hilltop Romanesque fortress with terraces offering panoramic views over the city.
detail_description: Castel San Pietro is a medieval fortress located on a hill overlooking the city of Verona. The fortress, built in 1398, offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding area. Visitors can reach the castle by taking the Funicolare di Castel San Pietro, a funicular railway that runs up to the hill. While entry into the castle itself is not permitted, many tourists enjoy walking through the beautiful tree-lined streets and capturing picturesque views of Verona from this vantage point.
name: Castel San Pietro
address: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro, 2, 37129 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Verona is a city in northern Italy’s Veneto region, with a medieval old town built between the meandering Adige River. It’s famous for being the setting of Shakespeare’s "Romeo and Juliet." A 14th-century residence with a tiny balcony overlooking a courtyard is said be “Juliet’s House." The Verona Arena is a huge 1st-century Roman amphitheater, which currently hosts concerts and large-scale opera performances.
detail_description: Verona, located in northern Italy's Veneto region, is a captivating city with a medieval old town nestled along the winding Adige River. Renowned as the backdrop for Shakespeare's 'Romeo and Juliet,' visitors can explore the iconic 14th-century 'Juliet's House' featuring a small balcony overlooking a courtyard. The city also boasts the impressive Verona Arena, an ancient Roman amphitheater hosting grand opera performances and concerts.
name: Verona

excerpt: Massive, ancient white-marble arch dismantled by the French and reassembled in 1932.
detail_description: Arco dei Gavi is a massive ancient white-marble arch that was originally constructed during the first century AD as part of the city defenses and served as a major gate into what is now the historic city center. It was dismantled by the French and later reassembled in 1932. The town of Arco, where it is located, has a Tyrolean feel with a ruined castle, beautiful churches, and palaces.
name: Arco dei Gavi

excerpt: Collection of sculpture, statues, paintings, ancient weapons & more within a restored palace.
detail_description: The Castelvecchio Museum in Verona is a restored palace that houses a diverse collection of sculptures, statues, paintings, ancient weapons, and more. Originally built as a residence and fortress in the 14th century, it now offers visitors an immersive experience into medieval life in Verona. The museum features 16 rooms filled with sacred art, Renaissance bronze statues, archaeological finds, coins, weapons, and armor.
name: Castelvecchio Museum

excerpt: Elaborate raised tombs for the Scaligeri family, 14th-century rulers shown here on horseback.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Verona, the Scaliger Tombs stand as a magnificent tribute to the powerful Scaligeri family, who ruled this enchanting city during the 13th and 14th centuries. These Gothic funerary monuments are not just tombs; they are intricate works of art that reflect the family's noble heritage and influence over medieval Verona.
name: Scaliger Tombs
address: Via S. Maria Antica, 4, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Dating to the 1st century, this arched limestone gate served as the main entrance to the city.
detail_description: Porta Borsari is an ancient limestone gate dating back to the 1st century, serving as the main entrance to the city of Verona. The area surrounding it is rich in history, with medieval and Renaissance palazzos waiting to be explored. Visitors can also experience the romantic ambiance of Juliet's House and its beautiful Renaissance frescoes.
name: Porta Borsari
address: Corso Porta Borsari, 57A, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Gothic-style 1300s house and museum, with a stone balcony, said to have inspired Shakespeare.
detail_description: Casa di Giulietta, also known as Juliets House, is a 13th-century gothic-style building in Verona that has become a popular tourist attraction. Although it was once owned by the Dal Cappello family and not the Capulets of Shakespeare's story, it still exudes an enchanting charm that captivates visitors.
name: Casa di Giulietta

excerpt: Large 13th-century church featuring a Gothic fresco by Pisanello, "St. George & the Princess."
detail_description: Basilica di Santa Anastasia, also known as Chiesa di Santa Anastasia, is a grand 13th-century Gothic church located in the heart of Verona, Italy. This impressive basilica is renowned for its stunning architecture and exquisite artwork, including a remarkable Gothic fresco by Pisanello depicting 'St. George & the Princess.'
name: Basilica di Santa Anastasia

excerpt: Road running beside hilltop fortress, with a terrace offering elevated views of the city.
detail_description: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro is a medieval fortress located on a hilltop above Verona, offering breathtaking views of the city from its terrace. The best time to visit is at sunset when the sky transforms into a beautiful display of oranges and the sun dips below the horizon. The architecture of this historic building is remarkable, and it was strategically positioned by the Romans for defense against intruders.
name: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro

excerpt: Brick & marble bridge with 3 spans & arches, built in the 14th century & reconstructed after WWII.
detail_description: Ponte Scaligero is a historic bridge in Verona, Italy, with a rich past dating back to the 14th century. It features brick and marble construction with three spans and arches. The bridge was reconstructed after being destroyed during World War II, using parts of the original structure. Visitors can enjoy stunning river and city views from the bridge, as well as picturesque photo opportunities along its narrow walkway.
name: Scaliger Bridge

excerpt: Church with a lower romanesque level & an upper gothic level with an ornate wooden ceiling.
detail_description: San Fermo Maggiore is a historic Roman Catholic church located in Verona, Italy. It is celebrated for its exceptional combination of Romanesque and Gothic architectural elements. Originally built by Benedictine monks in the 11th century, the church underwent significant modifications during the 13th and 14th centuries under the Franciscan order. The unique design features a lower Romanesque church and an upper Gothic church, both adorned with remarkable frescoes and intricate wooden ceilings.
name: Chiesa di San Fermo Maggiore

detail_description: When visiting Verona, make sure to explore the Arena, a remarkably well-preserved Roman amphitheater located in Piazza Bra. This historical site offers a unique opportunity to witness opera performances and immerse yourself in ancient architecture. While in the area, take some time to wander through the delightful market at Piazza delle Erbe and pay a visit to Juliet's Balcony, despite its fictional origins. Embrace the rich history and cultural experiences that Verona has to offer.
name: Arena

excerpt: Striped Romanesque cathedral opening to a lavish, frescoed interior & artwork by Titian.
detail_description: Complesso del Duomo di Verona, also known as the Complex of the Dumo, is a collection of ancient Christian buildings in Verona. The main attraction is the Cattedrale di Santa Maria Matricolare, a stunning example of Romanesque architecture with Gothic influences. The cathedral houses an impressive Assumption of the Virgin painting by Titian and features a lavish interior adorned with frescoes.
name: Cattedrale di Santa Maria Matricolare

excerpt: This 15th-century loggia & its attached building feature marble columns, sculptures & paintings.
detail_description: The Loggia del Consiglio, a 15th-century structure located in Verona, Italy, is an exquisite example of Renaissance architecture. This building and its attached structure boast stunning marble columns, sculptures, and paintings. The loggia was constructed at the request of the Municipality of Verona to serve as a meeting place for the Fatherland Council.
name: Loggia del Consiglio
address: P.za dei Signori, 1, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Storied, historic town plaza surrounded by cafes & buildings with quaint architecture.
detail_description: Piazza delle Erbe, also known as Piazza Erbe, is a storied and historic town plaza located in the north of Verona. Surrounded by cafes and buildings with quaint architecture, it has been a trendy meeting point for locals and tourists alike. The square is bustling with life during the day, hosting a vibrant market where tourists can weave through the stalls. In the evening, it transforms into a souvenir market with bright lights illuminating the area.
name: Piazza delle Erbe

excerpt: Surrounded by notable buildings, this public square features a statue of Dante Alighieri & cafes.
detail_description: Piazza dei Signori, also known as Dante's Square, is a historic public square located in the north of Verona's city center. Surrounded by notable buildings and connected by arcades, it holds great significance as the political center of the city. The square features a prominent statue of Dante Alighieri and several cafes. Once crucial for Verona's governance, it now stands as an intricately organized and lovely square with historical importance.
name: Piazza dei Signori
address: P.za dei Signori, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Narrow pedestrian thoroughfare featuring a variety of designer apparel boutiques & cafes.
detail_description: Via Giuseppe Mazzini is a narrow pedestrian street located in the heart of Verona's historic center, known for its array of designer boutiques and charming cafes. This major shopping destination boasts an impressive lineup of globally recognized brands such as Gucci, Louis Vuitton, and Dolce & Gabbana, alongside more affordable options like Zara and Bershka.
name: Via Giuseppe Mazzini

excerpt: Built from 1609 to 1853, this palace featuring a covered area with arches hosts events & exhibits.
detail_description: The Palazzo della Gran Guardia, located in the lively Piazza Bra of Verona, is a majestic Neo-Classical palace built over two floors and an attic. With its impressive length of eighty-six meters and thirteen large arches on the ground floor, it stands as a symbol of architectural grandeur. Originally intended for military use, this yellow-colored stone structure was completed in 1853 after construction began in the early 1600s.
name: Palazzo della Gran Guardia

excerpt: Well preserved & refurbished Roman arena hosting leading opera companies & popular music concerts.
detail_description: Fondazione Arena di Verona is a well-preserved and renovated Roman amphitheater, standing as the most significant monument in the city. Dating back to the 1st century, it is the third-largest of its kind in Italy. With a capacity for up to 25,000 attendees, it hosts various musical events including opera performances by Verona's leading companies and the renowned opera festival known as Festival lirico all'Arena di Verona since 1913.
name: Fondazione Arena di Verona

detail_description: Casa di Romeo, also known as Romeo's House, is a historic mansion in Verona dating back to the 13th century. The gothic entrance gate, crenelated walls, and brick facade make it a stunning sight. Inside the courtyard stands the famous balcony and a bronze statue of Juliet by Nereo Costantini.
name: Casa di Romeo
address: Via Arche Scaligere, 3a, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

detail_description: Valpolicella Tasting - Wine & Food Tours in Verona offers an incredible opportunity to explore the enchanting Valpolicella wine region, known for its exquisite reds like the renowned Amarone. This area, located east of Lake Garda, is celebrated for its diverse wine styles, including the lighter Classico and Superiore varieties. Each type has unique flavors and aromas that cater to different occasions.
name: Valpolicella Tasting - Wine & Food Tours in Verona
address: Via XXIV Maggio, 18/c, 37126 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Historic Catholic church with a 15th-century bell tower & walls of alternating brick & stone.
detail_description: Basilica di San Lorenzo in Verona, Italy is a historic Catholic church known for its remarkable Romanesque architecture. Built in the 12th century, it boasts twin cylindrical towers at the entrance and an interior adorned with alternating bands of brick and stone. Despite being off the beaten path, this 4th-century church near the river has survived earthquakes and offers a peaceful retreat from crowds.
name: Basilica di San Lorenzo, Verona

excerpt: Public gardens dating from the 16th century & arranged in a formal, tiered style with terraces.
detail_description: Giusti Garden, situated in Verona, Italy, is a well-known public garden dating back to the 16th century. This serene oasis offers a formal tiered layout with terraces and is adorned with sculptures and artfully planted trees. Visitors can enjoy a tranquil escape from the city's hustle and bustle amidst lush greenery and meticulously manicured landscapes. The garden also provides breathtaking views of the city.
name: Giusti Garden
address: Via Giardino Giusti, 2, 37129 Verona VR, Italy

detail_description: I Portoni della Brà, also known as the Doors of the Bra or The Archway at the Piazza Bra, is a medieval gateway to the historic city of Verona, Italy. It served as a passage between the city and its surrounding suburban countryside. Made of Verona marble, this archway features two arches and a clock installed in 1872. Nearby, visitors can find modern car parks for convenient parking.
name: I Portoni della Bra
address: Corso Porta Nuova, 2, 37122 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Built during the Roman Republic, this ancient gate features a double facade & 2 towers.
detail_description: Porta Leoni is an ancient gate in Verona, dating back to the Roman Republic. It boasts a double facade and two towers, offering evidence of ancient Rome's influence on the city. The gate was initially known as Porta San Fermo during the Middle Ages due to its proximity to a church of the same name. Later, it earned its current name from a nearby Roman sarcophagus featuring two lions.
name: Porta Leoni

excerpt: A collection of ancient & contemporary art in an elegant 17th-century mansion museum.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Verona, Palazzo Maffei Casa Museo stands as a stunning testament to the city's rich artistic heritage. This elegant 17th-century mansion has been transformed into a captivating house museum that showcases an impressive collection of both ancient and contemporary art. Visitors are treated to an immersive experience where they can admire exquisite masterpieces while exploring the beautifully preserved rooms of this Baroque residence.
name: House Museum Palazzo Maffei

detail_description: The Statua of Dante Alighieri is a famous, rather pensive statue of the renowned poet standing on Piazza dei Signori in Cangrande's residence where he lived from 1312 to 1318. It was created by Ugo Zannoni in 1865 and stands as a popular tourist attraction. The statue portrays Dante looking lost as if he is taking in the sights and sounds of this lively city.
name: Statua di Dante Alighieri
address: P.za dei Signori, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

detail_description: Looking for budget-friendly car rental options near Verona Stazione? Look no further than Budget Autonoleggio. The staff is known for being super friendly and helpful, providing clear explanations and excellent customer service in English. The location is convenient, within walking distance to the main attractions and historic center. Whether you're traveling solo or with friends, you can find a suitable accommodation that fits your budget at B&B Primavera, located just minutes away from Verona Arena.
name: Budget Autonoleggio - Verona Stazione

excerpt: Stone defense gate built in the early 16th century once forming a southern entrance to the city.
detail_description: Porta Nuova is a stone defense gate that was constructed in the early 16th century and served as a southern entrance to the city. It is located just south of the historic center, making it easily accessible for visitors interested in exploring the old medieval city. The neighborhood around Porta Nuova is close to the main attractions of Verona and offers a variety of bars and clubs, making it an ideal base for sightseeing with some nightlife fun.
name: Porta Nuova
address: Corso Porta Nuova, 37122 Verona VR, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Barbieri, also known as Palazzo del Comune, is a stunning Neoclassical building located opposite the Roman Arena in Verona. Designed by Giuseppe Barbieri and completed in 1848, it now serves as the Town Hall housing the Municipal Administration. The palace's rich history and impressive architecture make it a must-see attraction in Verona. Visitors can admire its grandeur while sitting on the stairs and enjoying the beautiful square view.
name: Palazzo Barbieri - Comune di Verona

detail_description: Teatro Romano is a well-preserved Roman theatre located in the historical center of Verona, Italy. It stands out as one of the best-preserved Roman theatres in northern Italy and is still used for staging shows during the summer season. The adjacent archaeological museum housed in a former 15th-century convent offers an immersive experience, showcasing numerous Roman artifacts and hosting themed temporary exhibitions.
name: Teatro Romano

excerpt: Ornate, 18th-century theater with balconies & a grand chandelier for Italian & international operas.
detail_description: Teatro Filarmonico is an exquisite 18th-century theater in Verona, Italy. While many visitors associate Verona's musical scene with summer operas in the Roman amphitheater, Teatro Filarmonico offers year-round performances. Founded in 1761, this intimate venue hosts Italian and international operas, as well as concerts and ballets like Don Giovanni and Swan Lake.
name: Teatro Filarmonico

detail_description: Romeo's Guest House is a private home near the Arche Scaligere, marked by a simple sign. It offers apartments for one-night stays with relative comfort. The communal apartment consists of three separate rooms with shared facilities and is inhabited by a friendly Italian couple who are accommodating and helpful. The location is excellent, just 5 minutes from Piazza Erbe and Piazza dei Signori in a very quiet area.
name: Romeo's Guest House

detail_description: Vicolo Duomo is a charming and picturesque alleyway located near the famous cathedral in the heart of the city. Lined with historic buildings, quaint cafes, and artisan shops, it offers a delightful atmosphere for leisurely strolls and exploration. The narrow cobblestone pathway is steeped in history and provides a glimpse into the local culture. Visitors can immerse themselves in the authentic ambiance of this ancient thoroughfare while admiring its architectural beauty.
name: Vicolo Duomo

detail_description: If you're planning a trip to Verona, the "Appartamento nel Centro Storico di Verona" is an excellent choice for your stay. Nestled in the heart of the historic center, this charming two-bedroom apartment offers a perfect blend of comfort and convenience. You'll find it situated at the beginning of a restricted traffic zone, making it easy to navigate with luggage while also allowing you to explore the city on foot effortlessly.
name: Appartamento nel Centro Storico di Verona

detail_description: The Luxury Verona Apartment City Centre offers a prime location in the heart of Verona, just 5 minutes from the station and 15 minutes from the city center. The apartment is well-maintained and welcoming, situated in a valuable historical context. Guests can enjoy spa services and a jacuzzi overlooking the Verona Arena at this luxurious accommodation. With near-perfect reviews, it's an excellent spot to relax and indulge in the lap of luxury during your time in Verona.
name: Luxury Verona Apartment City Centre
address: Corso Porta Nuova, 133, 37122 Verona VR, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Duomo is a captivating square that serves as the gateway to Verona's magnificent Cathedral, dedicated to Santa Maria Matricolare. This historical site is rich in artistry, featuring stunning frescoes and intricate sculptures that tell tales of the past. Originally built in Romanesque style, the cathedral underwent a transformation into Gothic architecture following an earthquake in 1117. Visitors can enjoy picturesque views of its impressive facade adorned with a striking bronze angel statue.
name: Piazza Duomo

excerpt: Large central plaza flanked by cafes & historic sites, with a garden & fountain at its center.
detail_description: P.za Brà is a spacious square in the heart of the city, surrounded by charming cafes and significant historical landmarks. At its center, there's a lovely garden and an elegant fountain. The highlight of this area is the Verona Roman Arena, an impressive ancient structure that takes center stage in P.za Brà.
name: P.za Bra

excerpt: Open-air plays & concerts in a theatre built in the era of Augustus, plus an archaeology museum.
detail_description: Nestled beside the ancient Roman theater, the Museo Archeologico al Teatro Romano is a treasure trove for history enthusiasts and culture lovers alike. Established in 1924, this museum showcases an impressive array of archaeological artifacts from Verona and its surroundings, including stunning mosaics, intricate sculptures, and fascinating household items. With around 600 works on display inside the museum and an additional 150 pieces showcased in the external cloister and theater area, visitors can immerse themselves in the rich tapestry of Roman life.
name: Museo Archeologico al Teatro Romano

excerpt: Museum featuring modern works of art from the collection of Achille Forti & other major patrons.
detail_description: Galleria d'Arte Moderna Achille Forti is a museum housed in the Romanesque Palazzo della Ragione, located near the Torre dei Lamberti in Verona. The collection features modern paintings and sculptures from 1840 to 1940, showcasing influential Italian artists like Giorgio Morandi and Umberto Boccioni. It brings together the Achille Forti collection and selections from Fondazione Domus collections, covering works by Italian avant-garde artists.
name: Galleria d'Arte Moderna Achille Forti
address: Cortile Mercato Vecchio, 6, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

excerpt: Hilltop church & sanctuary housed in a former fort with picturesque views of surrounding city.
detail_description: Perched atop a hill, the Santuario della Madonna di Lourdes offers breathtaking panoramic views of Verona that are simply unmatched. This remarkable sanctuary, housed in a former fort, stands even higher than the renowned Castel San Pietro. The journey to reach it may take around 25 to 30 minutes on foot from the historic city center along a well-trodden path, but every step is worth it for the stunning vistas awaiting you at the summit.
name: Santuario della Madonna di Lourdes
address: Viale dei Colli, 27, 37128 Verona VR, Italy

detail_description: The Ponte della Vittoria is a bridge located in Verona, Italy, built to celebrate the victory over Austria and Germany in World War I. The bridge was dedicated on November 4th 1918, Vittoria Venet Day. It is named after Italian patriot Vittorio Veneto.
name: Ponte della Vittoria

excerpt: Museum within a 13th century convent showing frescoes from the Middle Ages, plus Roman sculpture.
detail_description: Tomba di Giulietta is a museum located in the convent of San Francesco al Corso, showcasing frescoes from the Middle Ages and Roman sculptures. Legend has it that this site received the body of Juliet, along with her beloved Romeo. Visitors can explore the Tomb of Juliet and also discover an Asian version of Romeo & Juliet monument at the entrance. The museum offers a glimpse into Verona's history and art, making it a worthwhile stop for those interested in ancient artifacts and medieval art.
name: Tomba di Giulietta
address: Via Luigi da Porto, 5, 37122 Verona VR, Italy
